nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SR-8.

nodes.name: Supply Chain Protection | Critical Information System Components
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into MA-6, RA-9.

nodes.name: Supply Chain Protection | Identity and Traceability
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SR-4(1), SR-4(2).

nodes.name: Supply Chain Protection | Processes to Address Weaknesses or Deficiencies
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SR-3.

nodes.name: Trustworthiness
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SA-8.

nodes.name: Criticality Analysis
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into RA-9.

nodes.name: Criticality Analysis | Critical Components with No Viable Alternative Sourcing
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SA-20.

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools
Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Quality Metrics
nodes.description:
Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:

(a) Define quality metrics at the beginning of the development process; and
(b) Provide evidence of meeting the quality metrics [Selection (one or more): [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]; [Assignment: organization-defined program review milestones]; upon delivery].

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Security and Privacy Tracking Tools
nodes.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to select and employ security and privacy tracking tools for use during the development process.

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Criticality Analysis
nodes.description:
Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to perform a criticality analysis:

(a) At the following decision points in the system development life cycle: [Assignment: organization-defined decision points in the system development life cycle]; and
(b) At the following level of rigor: [Assignment: organization-defined breadth and depth of criticality analysis].

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Threat Modeling and Vulnerability Analysis
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SA-11(2).

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Attack Surface Reduction
nodes.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to reduce attack surfaces to [Assignment: organization-defined thresholds].

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Continuous Improvement
nodes.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to implement an explicit process to continuously improve the development process.

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Automated Vulnerability Analysis
Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Reuse of Threat and Vulnerability Information
nodes.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to use threat modeling and vulnerability analyses from similar systems, components, or services to inform the current development process.

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Use of Live Data
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SA-3(2).

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Incident Response Plan
nodes.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide, implement, and test an incident response plan.

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Archive System or Component
nodes.description: Require the developer of the system or system component to archive the system or component to be released or delivered together with the corresponding evidence supporting the final security and privacy review.

nodes.name: Development Process, Standards, and Tools | Minimize Personally Identifiable Information
nodes.description: Require the developer of the system or system component to minimize the use of personally identifiable information in development and test environments.

nodes.name: Developer-provided Training
nodes.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide the following training on the correct use and operation of the implemented security and privacy functions, controls, and/or mechanisms: [Assignment: organization-defined training].

nodes.name: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design
nodes.description:
Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to produce a design specification and security and privacy architecture that:

a. Is consistent with the organization���s security and privacy architecture that is an integral part the organization���s enterprise architecture;
b. Accurately and completely describes the required security and privacy functionality, and the allocation of controls among physical and logical components; and
c. Expresses how individual security and privacy functions, mechanisms, and services work together to provide required security and privacy capabilities and a unified approach to protection.

nodes.name: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Formal Policy Model
nodes.description:
Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:

(a) Produce, as an integral part of the development process, a formal policy model describing the [Assignment: organization-defined elements of organizational security and privacy policy] to be enforced; and
(b) Prove that the formal policy model is internally consistent and sufficient to enforce the defined elements of the organizational security and privacy policy when implemented.

nodes.name: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Security-relevant Components
nodes.description:
Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:

(a) Define security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware; and
(b) Provide a rationale that the definition for security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware is complete.

nodes.name: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Formal Correspondence
Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Informal Correspondence
Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Conceptually Simple Design
nodes.description:
Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:

(a) Design and structure the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware to use a complete, conceptually simple protection mechanism with precisely defined semantics; and
(b) Internally structure the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware with specific regard for this mechanism.

nodes.name: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Structure for Testing
nodes.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to structure security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware to facilitate testing.

nodes.name: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Structure for Least Privilege
nodes.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to structure security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware to facilitate controlling access with least privilege.

nodes.name: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Orchestration
nodes.description: Design [Assignment: organization-defined critical systems or system components] with coordinated behavior to implement the following capabilities: [Assignment: organization-defined capabilities, by system or component].

nodes.name: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design | Design Diversity
nodes.description: Use different designs for [Assignment: organization-defined critical systems or system components] to satisfy a common set of requirements or to provide equivalent functionality.

nodes.name: Tamper Resistance and Detection
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into .

nodes.name: Tamper Resistance and Detection | Multiple Phases of System Development Life Cycle
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SR-9(1).

nodes.name: Tamper Resistance and Detection | Inspection of Systems or Components
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SR-10.

nodes.name: Component Authenticity
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into .

nodes.name: Component Authenticity | Anti-counterfeit Training
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SR-11(1).

nodes.name: Component Authenticity | Configuration Control for Component Service and Repair
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SR-11(2).

nodes.name: Component Authenticity | Component Disposal
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SR-12.

nodes.name: Component Authenticity | Anti-counterfeit Scanning
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SR-11(3).

nodes.name: Customized Development of Critical Components
nodes.description: Reimplement or custom develop the following critical system components: [Assignment: organization-defined critical system components].

nodes.name: Developer Screening
nodes.description:
Require that the developer of [Assignment: organization-defined system, system component, or system service]:

a. Has appropriate access authorizations as determined by assigned [Assignment: organization-defined official government duties]; and
b. Satisfies the following additional personnel screening criteria: [Assignment: organization-defined additional personnel screening criteria].

nodes.name: Developer Screening | Validation of Screening
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SA-21.

nodes.name: Unsupported System Components
nodes.description:
a. Replace system components when support for the components is no longer available from the developer, vendor, or manufacturer; or
b. Provide the following options for alternative sources for continued support for unsupported components [Selection (one or more): in-house support; [Assignment: organization-defined support from external providers]].

nodes.name: Unsupported System Components | Alternative Sources for Continued Support
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SA-22.

nodes.name: Specialization
nodes.description: Employ [Selection (one or more): design; modification; augmentation; reconfiguration] on [Assignment: organization-defined systems or system components] supporting mission essential services or functions to increase the trustworthiness in those systems or components.

nodes.name: Policy and Procedures
nodes.description:
a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]:

1. [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level; System-level] system and communications protection policy that:

(a) Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
(b) Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system and communications protection policy and the associated system and communications protection controls;
b. Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the system and communications protection policy and procedures; and
c. Review and update the current system and communications protection:

1. Policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events]; and
2. Procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

nodes.name: Separation of System and User Functionality
nodes.description: Separate user functionality, including user interface services, from system management functionality.

nodes.name: Separation of System and User Functionality | Interfaces for Non-privileged Users
nodes.description: Prevent the presentation of system management functionality at interfaces to non-privileged users.

nodes.name: Separation of System and User Functionality | Disassociability
nodes.description: Store state information from applications and software separately.

nodes.name: Security Function Isolation
nodes.description: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

nodes.name: Security Function Isolation | Hardware Separation
nodes.description: Employ hardware separation mechanisms to implement security function isolation.

nodes.name: Security Function Isolation | Access and Flow Control Functions
nodes.description: Isolate security functions enforcing access and information flow control from nonsecurity functions and from other security functions.

nodes.name: Security Function Isolation | Minimize Nonsecurity Functionality
nodes.description: Minimize the number of nonsecurity functions included within the isolation boundary containing security functions.

nodes.name: Security Function Isolation | Module Coupling and Cohesiveness
nodes.description: Implement security functions as largely independent modules that maximize internal cohesiveness within modules and minimize coupling between modules.

nodes.name: Security Function Isolation | Layered Structures
nodes.description: Implement security functions as a layered structure minimizing interactions between layers of the design and avoiding any dependence by lower layers on the functionality or correctness of higher layers.

nodes.name: Information in Shared System Resources
nodes.description: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

nodes.name: Information in Shared System Resources | Security Levels
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-4.

nodes.name: Information in Shared System Resources | Multilevel or Periods Processing
nodes.description: Prevent unauthorized information transfer via shared resources in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined procedures] when system processing explicitly switches between different information classification levels or security categories.

nodes.name: Denial-of-service Protection
nodes.description:
a. [Selection: Protect against; Limit] the effects of the following types of denial-of-service events: [Assignment: organization-defined types of denial-of-service events]; and
b. Employ the following controls to achieve the denial-of-service objective: [Assignment: organization-defined controls by type of denial-of-service event].

nodes.name: Denial-of-service Protection | Restrict Ability to Attack Other Systems
nodes.description: Restrict the ability of individuals to launch the following denial-of-service attacks against other systems: [Assignment: organization-defined denial-of-service attacks].

nodes.name: Denial-of-service Protection | Capacity, Bandwidth, and Redundancy
nodes.description: Manage capacity, bandwidth, or other redundancy to limit the effects of information flooding denial-of-service attacks.

nodes.name: Denial-of-service Protection | Detection and Monitoring
nodes.description:
(a) Employ the following monitoring tools to detect indicators of denial-of-service attacks against, or launched from, the system: [Assignment: organization-defined monitoring tools]; and
(b) Monitor the following system resources to determine if sufficient resources exist to prevent effective denial-of-service attacks: [Assignment: organization-defined system resources].

nodes.name: Resource Availability
nodes.description: Protect the availability of resources by allocating [Assignment: organization-defined resources] by [Selection (one or more): priority; quota; [Assignment: organization-defined controls]].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection
Boundary Protection | Physically Separated Subnetworks
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-7.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Public Access
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-7.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Access Points
nodes.description: Limit the number of external network connections to the system.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | External Telecommunications Services
Boundary Protection | Deny by Default ��� Allow by Exception
nodes.description: Deny network communications traffic by default and allow network communications traffic by exception [Selection (one or more): at managed interfaces; for [Assignment: organization-defined systems]].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Response to Recognized Failures
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-7(18).

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Split Tunneling for Remote Devices
nodes.description: Prevent split tunneling for remote devices connecting to organizational systems unless the split tunnel is securely provisioned using [Assignment: organization-defined safeguards].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Route Traffic to Authenticated Proxy Servers
nodes.description: Route [Assignment: organization-defined internal communications traffic] to [Assignment: organization-defined external networks] through authenticated proxy servers at managed interfaces.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Restrict Threatening Outgoing Communications Traffic
nodes.description:
(a) Detect and deny outgoing communications traffic posing a threat to external systems; and
(b) Audit the identity of internal users associated with denied communications.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Prevent Exfiltration
nodes.description:
(a) Prevent the exfiltration of information; and
(b) Conduct exfiltration tests [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Restrict Incoming Communications Traffic
nodes.description: Only allow incoming communications from [Assignment: organization-defined authorized sources] to be routed to [Assignment: organization-defined authorized destinations].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Host-based Protection
nodes.description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined host-based boundary protection mechanisms] at [Assignment: organization-defined system components].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Isolation of Security Tools, Mechanisms, and Support Components
nodes.description: Isolate [Assignment: organization-defined information security tools, mechanisms, and support components] from other internal system components by implementing physically separate subnetworks with managed interfaces to other components of the system.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Protect Against Unauthorized Physical Connections
nodes.description: Protect against unauthorized physical connections at [Assignment: organization-defined managed interfaces].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Networked Privileged Accesses
nodes.description: Route networked, privileged accesses through a dedicated, managed interface for purposes of access control and auditing.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Prevent Discovery of System Components
nodes.description: Prevent the discovery of specific system components that represent a managed interface.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Automated Enforcement of Protocol Formats
nodes.description: Enforce adherence to protocol formats.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Fail Secure
nodes.description: Prevent systems from entering unsecure states in the event of an operational failure of a boundary protection device.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Block Communication from Non-organizationally Configured Hosts
nodes.description: Block inbound and outbound communications traffic between [Assignment: organization-defined communication clients] that are independently configured by end users and external service providers.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Dynamic Isolation and Segregation
nodes.description: Provide the capability to dynamically isolate [Assignment: organization-defined system components] from other system components.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Isolation of System Components
nodes.description: Employ boundary protection mechanisms to isolate [Assignment: organization-defined system components] supporting [Assignment: organization-defined missions and/or business functions].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Separate Subnets for Connecting to Different Security Domains
nodes.description: Implement separate network addresses to connect to systems in different security domains.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Disable Sender Feedback on Protocol Validation Failure
nodes.description: Disable feedback to senders on protocol format validation failure.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Personally Identifiable Information
Boundary Protection | Unclassified National Security System Connections
nodes.description: Prohibit the direct connection of [Assignment: organization-defined unclassified national security system] to an external network without the use of [Assignment: organization-defined boundary protection device].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Classified National Security System Connections
nodes.description: Prohibit the direct connection of a classified national security system to an external network without the use of [Assignment: organization-defined boundary protection device].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Unclassified Non-national Security System Connections
nodes.description: Prohibit the direct connection of [Assignment: organization-defined unclassified non-national security system] to an external network without the use of [Assignment: organization-defined boundary protection device].

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Connections to Public Networks
nodes.description: Prohibit the direct connection of [Assignment: organization-defined system] to a public network.

nodes.name: Boundary Protection | Separate Subnets to Isolate Functions
nodes.description: Implement [Selection: physically; logically] separate subnetworks to isolate the following critical system components and functions: [Assignment: organization-defined critical system components and functions].

nodes.name: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity
nodes.description: Protect the [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] of transmitted information.

nodes.name: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity | Cryptographic Protection
nodes.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to [Selection (one or more): prevent unauthorized disclosure of information; detect changes to information] during transmission.

nodes.name: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity | Pre- and Post-transmission Handling
nodes.description: Maintain the [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] of information during preparation for transmission and during reception.

nodes.name: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity | Cryptographic Protection for Message Externals
nodes.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect message externals unless otherwise protected by [Assignment: organization-defined alternative physical controls].

nodes.name: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity | Conceal or Randomize Communications
nodes.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to conceal or randomize communication patterns unless otherwise protected by [Assignment: organization-defined alternative physical controls].

nodes.name: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity | Protected Distribution System
nodes.description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined protected distribution system] to [Selection (one or more): prevent unauthorized disclosure of information; detect changes to information] during transmission.

nodes.name: Transmission Confidentiality
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-8.

nodes.name: Network Disconnect
nodes.description: Terminate the network connection associated with a communications session at the end of the session or after [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of inactivity.

nodes.name: Trusted Path
nodes.description:
a. Provide a [Selection: physically; logically] isolated trusted communications path for communications between the user and the trusted components of the system; and
b. Permit users to invoke the trusted communications path for communications between the user and the following security functions of the system, including at a minimum, authentication and re-authentication: [Assignment: organization-defined security functions].

nodes.name: Trusted Path | Irrefutable Communications Path
nodes.description:
(a) Provide a trusted communications path that is irrefutably distinguishable from other communications paths; and
(b) Initiate the trusted communications path for communications between the [Assignment: organization-defined security functions] of the system and the user.

nodes.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management
nodes.description: Establish and manage cryptographic keys when cryptography is employed within the system in accordance with the following key management requirements: [Assignment: organization-defined requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction].

nodes.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management | Availability
nodes.description: Maintain availability of information in the event of the loss of cryptographic keys by users.

nodes.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management | Symmetric Keys
nodes.description: Produce, control, and distribute symmetric cryptographic keys using [Selection: NIST FIPS-validated; NSA-approved] key management technology and processes.

nodes.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management | Asymmetric Keys
nodes.description: Produce, control, and distribute asymmetric cryptographic keys using [Selection: NSA-approved key management technology and processes; prepositioned keying material; DoD-approved or DoD-issued Medium Assurance PKI certificates; DoD-approved or DoD-issued Medium Hardware Assurance PKI certificates and hardware security tokens that protect the user���s private key; certificates issued in accordance with organization-defined requirements].

nodes.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management | PKI Certificates
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-12(3).

nodes.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management | PKI Certificates / Hardware Tokens
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-12(3).

nodes.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management | Physical Control of Keys
nodes.description: Maintain physical control of cryptographic keys when stored information is encrypted by external service providers.

nodes.name: Cryptographic Protection
nodes.description:
a. Determine the [Assignment: organization-defined cryptographic uses]; and
b. Implement the following types of cryptography required for each specified cryptographic use: [Assignment: organization-defined types of cryptography for each specified cryptographic use].

nodes.name: Cryptographic Protection | Fips-validated Cryptography
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-13.

nodes.name: Cryptographic Protection | Nsa-approved Cryptography
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-13.

nodes.name: Cryptographic Protection | Individuals Without Formal Access Approvals
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-13.

nodes.name: Cryptographic Protection | Digital Signatures
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-13.

nodes.name: Public Access Protections
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AC-2, AC-3, AC-5, AC-6, SI-10, SI-3, SI-4, SI-5, SI-7.

nodes.name: Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications
nodes.description:
a. Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices and applications with the following exceptions: [Assignment: organization-defined exceptions where remote activation is to be allowed]; and
b. Provide an explicit indication of use to users physically present at the devices.

nodes.name: Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications | Physical or Logical Disconnect
nodes.description: Provide [Selection (one or more): physical; logical] disconnect of collaborative computing devices in a manner that supports ease of use.

nodes.name: Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications | Blocking Inbound and Outbound Communications Traffic
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-7.

nodes.name: Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications | Disabling and Removal in Secure Work Areas
nodes.description: Disable or remove collaborative computing devices and applications from [Assignment: organization-defined systems or system components] in [Assignment: organization-defined secure work areas].

nodes.name: Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications | Explicitly Indicate Current Participants
nodes.description: Provide an explicit indication of current participants in [Assignment: organization-defined online meetings and teleconferences].

nodes.name: Transmission of Security and Privacy Attributes
nodes.description: Associate [Assignment: organization-defined security and privacy attributes] with information exchanged between systems and between system components.

nodes.name: Transmission of Security and Privacy Attributes | Integrity Verification
nodes.description: Verify the integrity of transmitted security and privacy attributes.

nodes.name: Transmission of Security and Privacy Attributes | Anti-spoofing Mechanisms
nodes.description: Implement anti-spoofing mechanisms to prevent adversaries from falsifying the security attributes indicating the successful application of the security process.

nodes.name: Transmission of Security and Privacy Attributes | Cryptographic Binding
nodes.description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined mechanisms or techniques] to bind security and privacy attributes to transmitted information.

nodes.name: Public Key Infrastructure Certificates
nodes.description:
a. Issue public key certificates under an [Assignment: organization-defined certificate policy] or obtain public key certificates from an approved service provider; and
b. Include only approved trust anchors in trust stores or certificate stores managed by the organization.

nodes.name: Mobile Code
nodes.description:
a. Define acceptable and unacceptable mobile code and mobile code technologies; and
b. Authorize, monitor, and control the use of mobile code within the system.

nodes.name: Mobile Code | Identify Unacceptable Code and Take Corrective Actions
nodes.description: Identify [Assignment: organization-defined unacceptable mobile code] and take [Assignment: organization-defined corrective actions].

nodes.name: Mobile Code | Acquisition, Development, and Use
nodes.description: Verify that the acquisition, development, and use of mobile code to be deployed in the system meets [Assignment: organization-defined mobile code requirements].

nodes.name: Mobile Code | Prevent Downloading and Execution
nodes.description: Prevent the download and execution of [Assignment: organization-defined unacceptable mobile code].

nodes.name: Mobile Code | Prevent Automatic Execution
nodes.description: Prevent the automatic execution of mobile code in [Assignment: organization-defined software applications] and enforce [Assignment: organization-defined actions] prior to executing the code.

nodes.name: Mobile Code | Allow Execution Only in Confined Environments
nodes.description: Allow execution of permitted mobile code only in confined virtual machine environments.

nodes.name: Voice Over Internet Protocol
nodes.description: Withdrawn: Technology-specific; addressed as any other technology or protocol.

nodes.name: Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Authoritative Source)
nodes.description:
a. Provide additional data origin authentication and integrity verification artifacts along with the authoritative name resolution data the system returns in response to external name/address resolution queries; and
b. Provide the means to indicate the security status of child zones and (if the child supports secure resolution services) to enable verification of a chain of trust among parent and child domains, when operating as part of a distributed, hierarchical namespace.

nodes.name: Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Authoritative Source) | Child Subspaces
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-20.

nodes.name: Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Authoritative Source) | Data Origin and Integrity
nodes.description: Provide data origin and integrity protection artifacts for internal name/address resolution queries.

nodes.name: Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Recursive or Caching Resolver)
nodes.description: Request and perform data origin authentication and data integrity verification on the name/address resolution responses the system receives from authoritative sources.

nodes.name: Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Recursive or Caching Resolver) | Data Origin and Integrity
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-21.

nodes.name: Architecture and Provisioning for Name/Address Resolution Service
nodes.description: Ensure the systems that collectively provide name/address resolution service for an organization are fault-tolerant and implement internal and external role separation.

nodes.name: Session Authenticity
nodes.description: Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.

nodes.name: Session Authenticity | Invalidate Session Identifiers at Logout
nodes.description: Invalidate session identifiers upon user logout or other session termination.

nodes.name: Session Authenticity | User-initiated Logouts and Message Displays
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into AC-12(1).

nodes.name: Session Authenticity | Unique System-generated Session Identifiers
nodes.description: Generate a unique session identifier for each session with [Assignment: organization-defined randomness requirements] and recognize only session identifiers that are system-generated.

nodes.name: Session Authenticity | Unique Session Identifiers with Randomization
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-23(3).

nodes.name: Session Authenticity | Allowed Certificate Authorities
nodes.description: Only allow the use of [Assignment: organization-defined certificate authorities] for verification of the establishment of protected sessions.

nodes.name: Fail in Known State
nodes.description: Fail to a [Assignment: organization-defined known system state] for the following failures on the indicated components while preserving [Assignment: organization-defined system state information] in failure: [Assignment: list of organization-defined types of system failures on organization-defined system components].

nodes.name: Thin Nodes
nodes.description: Employ minimal functionality and information storage on the following system components: [Assignment: organization-defined system components].

nodes.name: Decoys
nodes.description: Include components within organizational systems specifically designed to be the target of malicious attacks for detecting, deflecting, and analyzing such attacks.

nodes.name: Decoys | Detection of Malicious Code
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-35.

nodes.name: Platform-independent Applications
nodes.description: Include within organizational systems the following platform independent applications: [Assignment: organization-defined platform-independent applications].

nodes.name: Protection of Information at Rest
nodes.description: Protect the [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] of the following information at rest: [Assignment: organization-defined information at rest].

nodes.name: Protection of Information at Rest | Cryptographic Protection
nodes.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of the following information at rest on [Assignment: organization-defined system components or media]: [Assignment: organization-defined information].

nodes.name: Protection of Information at Rest | Offline Storage
nodes.description: Remove the following information from online storage and store offline in a secure location: [Assignment: organization-defined information].

nodes.name: Protection of Information at Rest | Cryptographic Keys
nodes.description: Provide protected storage for cryptographic keys [Selection: [Assignment: organization-defined safeguards]; hardware-protected key store].

nodes.name: Heterogeneity
nodes.description: Employ a diverse set of information technologies for the following system components in the implementation of the system: [Assignment: organization-defined system components].

nodes.name: Heterogeneity | Virtualization Techniques
nodes.description: Employ virtualization techniques to support the deployment of a diversity of operating systems and applications that are changed [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nodes.name: Concealment and Misdirection
nodes.description: Employ the following concealment and misdirection techniques for [Assignment: organization-defined systems] at [Assignment: organization-defined time periods] to confuse and mislead adversaries: [Assignment: organization-defined concealment and misdirection techniques].

nodes.name: Concealment and Misdirection | Virtualization Techniques
nodes.description: Withdrawn: incorporated into SC-29(1).

nodes.name: Concealment and Misdirection | Randomness
nodes.description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined techniques] to introduce randomness into organizational operations and assets.

nodes.name: Concealment and Misdirection | Change Processing and Storage Locations
nodes.description: Change the location of [Assignment: organization-defined processing and/or storage[Selection: [Assignment: organization-defined time frequency]; at random time intervals].

nodes.name: Concealment and Misdirection | Misleading Information
nodes.description: Employ realistic, but misleading information in [Assignment: organization-defined system components] about its security state or posture.

nodes.name: Concealment and Misdirection | Concealment of System Components
nodes.description: Employ the following techniques to hide or conceal [Assignment: organization-defined system components]: [Assignment: organization-defined techniques].

nodes.name: Covert Channel Analysis
nodes.description:
a. Perform a covert channel analysis to identify those aspects of communications within the system that are potential avenues for covert [Selection (one or more): storage; timing] channels; and
b. Estimate the maximum bandwidth of those channels.

nodes.name: Covert Channel Analysis | Test Covert Channels for Exploitability
nodes.description: Test a subset of the identified covert channels to determine the channels that are exploitable.

nodes.name: Information Fragmentation
nodes.description:

a. Fragment the following information: [Assignment: organization-defined information]; and

nodes.name: Policy and Procedures
nodes.description:
a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]:

1. [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level; System-level] supply chain risk management policy that:

(a) Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
(b) Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the supply chain risk management policy and the associated supply chain risk management controls;
b. Designate an [Assignment: organization-defined official] to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the supply chain risk management policy and procedures; and
c. Review and update the current supply chain risk management:

1. Policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events]; and
2. Procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

nodes.name: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan

nodes.description: Establish a supply chain risk management team consisting of [Assignment: organization-defined personnel, roles, and responsibilities] to lead and support the following SCRM activities: [Assignment: organization-defined supply chain risk management activities].

nodes.name: Supply Chain Controls and Processes
Supply Chain Controls and Processes | Diverse Supply Base
nodes.description: Employ a diverse set of sources for the following system components and services:  [Assignment: organization-defined system components and services].

nodes.name: Supply Chain Controls and Processes | Limitation of Harm
nodes.description: Employ the following controls to limit harm from potential adversaries identifying and targeting the organizational supply chain: [Assignment: organization-defined controls].

nodes.name: Supply Chain Controls and Processes | Sub-tier Flow Down
nodes.description: Ensure that the controls included in the contracts of prime contractors are also included in the contracts of subcontractors.

nodes.name: Provenance
nodes.description: Document, monitor, and maintain valid provenance of the following systems, system components, and associated data: [Assignment: organization-defined systems, system components, and associated data].

nodes.name: Provenance | Identity
nodes.description: Establish and maintain unique identification of the following supply chain elements, processes, and personnel associated with the identified system and critical system components: [Assignment: organization-defined supply chain elements, processes, and personnel associated with organization-defined systems and critical system components].

nodes.name: Provenance | Track and Trace
nodes.description: Establish and maintain unique identification of the following systems and critical system components for tracking through the supply chain: [Assignment: organization-defined systems and critical system components].

nodes.name: Provenance | Validate as Genuine and Not Altered
nodes.description: Employ the following controls to validate that the system or system component received is genuine and has not been altered: [Assignment: organization-defined controls].

nodes.name: Provenance | Supply Chain Integrity ��� Pedigree
nodes.description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined controls] and conduct [Assignment: organization-defined analysis] to ensure the integrity of the system and system components by validating the internal composition and provenance of critical or mission-essential technologies, products, and services.

nodes.name: Acquisition Strategies, Tools, and Methods

nodes.description: Assess the system, system component, or system service prior to selection, acceptance, modification, or update.

nodes.description: Assess and review the supply chain-related risks associated with suppliers or contractors and the system, system component, or system service they provide [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nodes.name: Supplier Assessments and Reviews | Testing and Analysis
nodes.description: Employ [Selection (one or more): organizational analysis; independent third-party analysis; organizational testing; independent third-party testing] of the following supply chain elements, processes, and actors associated with the system, system component, or system service: [Assignment: organization-defined supply chain elements, processes, and actors].

nodes.name: Supply Chain Operations Security
nodes.description: Employ the following Operations Security (OPSEC) controls to protect supply chain-related information for the system, system component, or system service: [Assignment: organization-defined Operations Security (OPSEC) controls].

nodes.name: Notification Agreements
nodes.description: Establish agreements and procedures with entities involved in the supply chain for the system, system component, or system service for the [Selection (one or more): notification of supply chain compromises; results of assessments or audits; [Assignment: organization-defined information]].

nodes.name: Tamper Resistance and Detection

nodes.name: Tamper Resistance and Detection | Multiple Stages of System Development Life Cycle
nodes.description: Employ anti-tamper technologies, tools, and techniques throughout the system development life cycle.

nodes.name: Inspection of Systems or Components
nodes.description: Inspect the following systems or system components [Selection (one or more): at random; at [Assignment: organization-defined frequency], upon [Assignment: organization-defined indications of need for inspection]] to detect tampering: [Assignment: organization-defined systems or system components].

nodes.description:
a. Develop and implement anti-counterfeit policy and procedures that include the means to detect and prevent counterfeit components from entering the system; and
b. Report counterfeit system components to [Selection (one or more): source of counterfeit component; [Assignment: organization-defined external reporting organizations]; [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]].

nodes.description: Train [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] to detect counterfeit system components (including hardware, software, and firmware).

nodes.name: Component Authenticity | Configuration Control for Component Service and Repair
nodes.description: Maintain configuration control over the following system components awaiting service or repair and serviced or repaired components awaiting return to service: [Assignment: organization-defined system components].

nodes.name: Component Authenticity | Anti-counterfeit Scanning
nodes.description: Scan for counterfeit system components [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nodes.control_question: Does the organization facilitate the implementation of cybersecurity & data protection governance controls?
nodes.control_text: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cybersecurity & data protection governance controls.

nodes.control_question: Does the organization coordinate cybersecurity, data protection and business alignment through a steering committee or advisory board, comprised of key cybersecurity, data privacy and business executives, which meets formally and on a regular basis?
nodes.control_text: Mechanisms exist to coordinate cybersecurity, data protection and business alignment through a steering committee or advisory board, comprised of key cybersecurity, data privacy and business executives, which meets formally and on a regular basis.

nodes.control_question: Does the organization provide governance oversight reporting and recommendations to those entrusted to make executive decisions about matters considered material to its cybersecurity & data protection program?

nodes.control_text: Mechanisms exist to establish, maintain and disseminate cybersecurity & data protection policies, standards and procedures.

nodes.control_text: Mechanisms exist to prohibit exceptions to standards, except when the exception has been formally assessed for risk impact, approved and recorded.
